1.comment: Huard is your backup. Croyle left the game with a shoulder injury. His YPA sucked (11-of-19 for 88 yards; 4.6 YPA) but he managed the game well and was victimized by some drops.

1.sentence: Huard, who went 2-of-4 for 17 yards and a pick, was benched in favor of Thigpen, who completed the game 14-of-33 for 151 yards, 1 touchdown and an interception.

2.comment: Huard. Huard, who went 2-of-4 for 17 yards and a pick, was benched in favor of Thigpen, who completed the game 14-of-33 for 151 yards, 1 touchdown and an interception. Croyle isn't that good, but there's a shot he could have actually completed more than 50 percent of his passes.

1.sentence: Huard's numbers looked less asthetic - 21-of-28, 160 yards and a touchdown - but unlike Cutler, he didn't give the ball up.

3.comment: Huard's numbers looked less asthetic - 21-of-28, 160 yards and a touchdown - but unlike Cutler, he didn't give the ball up. Huard proved that he was far superior to Tyler Thigpen, constantly moving the chains against Denver's pathetic defense. Unlike Thigpen, Huard is a functional NFL quarterback. With Thigpen, the Chiefs had a legitimate shot to go 0-16. With Huard, the sky's the limit - 5 victories might just be possible.    Of course, it helped that Huard had

4.comment: Huard tossed a pick on the very next play.    It's tough to say whether Kansas City's defense was more pathetic than its offense. I'd call it a draw. Check out the Panthers' play-calling on their first touchdown drive: Run 1 yard, run 4 yards, run 4 yards, run 14 yards, run 5 yards, run 10 yards (touchdown). Nice job, Chiefs. On Carolina's third drive, 10 of the Panthers' 11 plays were rushes. The only pass was an incompletion. Oh, and did I mention that Carolina was missing its 2 starting offensive tackles!? 5.comment: Huard, leave the game with injuries. Croyle was 9-of-10 for 63 yards before suffering a sprained knee. He's out for the year. Huard was 9-of-16 for 96 yards, but hurt his harm.
